content:
• Thursday, January 11, 2018
  • SBGI

    FCC pauses review of Sinclair Broadcast-Tribune Media merger

    • The FCC is pausing its review of a contentious $4B bid from Sinclair Broadcast Group (NASDAQ:SBGI) to buy out Tribune Media (NYSE:TRCO).
    • The agency's informal 180-day "shot clock" is on hold as it say it needs to "fully" evaluate Sinclair's offer of divestitures.
    • Sinclair shares got a boost yesterday when, as part of those planned divestitures, reports emerged that Fox was nearing a deal to buy 10 TV stations from Sinclair.
    • SBGI rose 1.7% today; shares are down 0.6% after hours. TRCO rose 0.5% during the regular session; FOX +1.4%; FOXA +1.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:56 PM | 7 Comments
  • TMHC

    Taylor Morrison -3.6% with offering coming at discount

    • Taylor Morrison (NYSE:TMHC) is 3.6% lower after hours after Bloomberg reports that an offering of 19.21M shares is expected to come in at $27.40-$28 per share.
    • That's a discount of 1.44%-3.56% from today's close of $28.41.
    • The shares are being offered by Taylor Morrison (17.7M shares) and shareholder TPG (1.5M shares). TMHC expects to use proceeds to buy partnership units in its direct subsidiary, and class B shares held by TPG and Oaktree Capital.
    • Separately it will buy back 3.75M partnership units and corresponding class B shares from equity sponsors.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:05 PM
  • TVPT

    Travelport Worldwide +3.8% on move into SmallCap 600

    • Travelport Worldwide (NYSE:TVPT) is up 3.8% after hours on word it's joining the S&P SmallCap 600.
    • The travel commerce platform company will replace Bob Evans Farms (NASDAQ:BOBE), which is set to be acquired by Post Holdings tomorrow.
    • The move is effective prior to the open of trading on Wednesday.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:33 PM

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers (1/11/2018)

    • Top gainers: PFMT +16.0%. ATRO +5.1%. STLD +3.7%. TAL +2.9%. SQNS +2.3%.
    • Top losers: AMSC -10.9%. KODK -3.0%. ATUS -2.5%. ZTO -1.7%. ZION -1.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:37 PM | 2 Comments
  • AMD

    AMD drops after acknowledging vulnerability to Spectre flaw

    • AMD (NASDAQ:AMD) shares drop following a Yahoo Finance interview with CEO Lisa Su, who acknowledges again that the company’s chips were affected by the Spectre security flaw.
    • Key quote: “To clarify, for Meltdown, AMD is not susceptible. We don’t have a susceptibility to that variant. But with Spectre, AMD is susceptible.”
    • As Google outlined in a blog post earlier today, the Spectre flaw comes in two variants Google called Variant 1 and Variant 2 while Meltdown was Variant 3. Variant 2 was the hardest problem to resolve.
    • AMD shares are down 3.6% aftermarket.
    • Intel (NASDAQ:INTC) shares are down 1.6%.
    • Previously: Intel unveils security updates, self-driving car (Jan. 9)
    • Previously: Microsoft suspends some chip patches due to PC freezing (Jan. 9)
    • Previously: Nvidia rolling out patches for chip security flaw (Jan. 10)
    • Update: Title updated for clarification that AMD had already disclosed a vulnerability to Spectre.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:54 PM | 304 Comments
  • VZ

    Discovery up again after conference talks, Verizon deal

    • Discovery Communications (DISCA) rose for the second day in a row, up 5.2% today, buoyed by strong comments at industry conferences.
    • In CEO David Zaslav's presentation at the Citigroup conference, he noted closing on extension of an affiliate deal with Verizon (NYSE:VZ) that was "quite favorable for us."
    • Meanwhile during a CES keynote, Zaslav pointed to the value of season passes for streaming individual sports vs. an aggregation of many sports.
    • "We don't need to own everything," he said, pointing to a bet that there are lots of fans who'd pay to have all access to certain sports via OTT video.
    • #CES18
     
     
     
     
    | 4:54 PM | 2 Comments
  • PEER

    Snap Interactive announces blockchain video-routing project

    • Snap Interactive (STVI) -- not the Snapchat folks, but the nanocap live video social-network applications maker -- has announced an open-source multimedia platform designed to combine its "live streaming video, voice and data routing capabilities with the enhanced security, scalability and cost effectiveness of blockchain technology."
    • Launch capabilities will include hosting Backchannel, a secure video messaging app the company plans to roll out this year.
    • “We are excited to announce this platform initiative as the core of our blockchain strategy,” says CEO Alex Harrington.
    • Shares rose 6.1% during the market session today.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:46 PM | 7 Comments
  • PBYI

    Puma Bio to adjust proposed labeling for neratinib after meeting with CHMP oncology advisory group; shares up 2% after hours

    • Puma Biotechnology (NYSE:PBYI) is up 2% after hours on the heels of its announcement that it plans to modify the summary product characteristics (product labeling) in its European marketing application for breast cancer candidate neratinib. Specifically, it will refine the intended treatment population to patients at high risk of disease recurrence.
    • The change was based on feedback from the Committee for Medicinal Products for Human Use (CHMP) Scientific Advisory Group on Oncology. CHMP asked the group for an opinion on the clinical relevance of the five-year absolute treatment difference in invasive disease-free survival observed in the ExteNET study and on the risk of gastrointestinal toxicity with neratinib and its fit in the proposed patient population in the company's marketing application.
    • CHMP will conduct an oral hearing on January 23 to discuss Puma's marketing application and has invited the company to present the risk/benefit profile of neratinib in the targeted population.
    • Previously: EMA requests additional data analyses on Puma's marketing application for breast cancer med neratinib; extended timeline for approval pressures shares, down 4% after hours (Aug. 2, 2017)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:31 PM | 6 Comments
  • SABR

    Sabre announces CFO retirement

    • Sabre (NASDAQ:SABR) announces the resignation of CFO Rick Simonson effective at year’s end.
    • Simonson will step down once a successor is appointed but will remain with the company as a senior advisor.   
    • Sabre shares are down 0.2% aftermarket.         
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM | 1 Comment
  • EXAS

    Exact Sciences launches $500M convertible debt offering; shares off 4% after hours

    • Exact Sciences (NASDAQ:EXAS) commences a public offering of $500M aggregate principal amount of convertible senior notes due 2025. Underwriters have a 30-day option to purchase up to an additional $75M of the notes.
    • The notes will be convertible into cash or common shares at the company's discretion.
    • Shares are down 4% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM | 7 Comments
  • CHK

    Nat gas names rise as U.S. supplies mark record weekly drop

    • Natural gas futures surged 6% to settle at $3.084/MMBtu, the highest finish for a most-active contract since November, as U.S. gas supplies tumbled by a record 359B cf last week, beating the analyst consensus estimate for a decrease of 337B cf.
    • The result was more than double the five-year average withdrawal of 169B cf for the week and far ahead of the previous record fall of 288B in January 2014 during the Polar Vortex.
    • The data suggest “the risk of an undersupplied gas market is really coming into focus - that new cold waves could really wipe out more inventory before we get to early March 2018,” says Seaport Global's Richard Hastings.
    • Gas producers are broadly higher, along with oil names: CHK +4.6%, RRC +2.9%, ECR +2.8%, AR +2.4%, GPOR +2.4%, SWN +2%, COG +1.6%, EQT +1.2%.
    • ETFs: UNG, UGAZ, DGAZ, BOIL, GASL, FCG, KOLD, UNL, GASX, DCNG, GAZB
     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM | 69 Comments
  • FOX

    Fox TV's Walden out of running for Amazon Studios chief

    • Fox TV Group Chairman (FOX +1.7%, FOXA +1.9%) Dana Walden has dropped out of the running to replace Roy Price at the head of Amazon Studios (AMZN +1.5%).
    • Talks were under way, but Walden will focus on the impending acquisition of Fox's media assets by Walt Disney instead, and she's likely to take a major TV role at the combined Disney/Fox enterprise.
    • Remaining candidates for Amazon include former Sony Pictures co-chairman Amy Pascal, NBC Entertainment President Jennifer Salke, A&E CEO Nancy Dubuc, and YouTube programming chief Susanne Daniels.
    • Albert Cheng is serving as interim chief for Amazon Studios, but the company is reportedly seeking a woman for the post considering that Price was ousted due to a sexual misconduct scandal.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 PM | 1 Comment
  • ARDM

    Ad Com thumbs down on Aradigm's Linhaliq

    • The FDA's Antimicrobial Drugs Advisory Committee has voted 3 - 12 (1 - abstain) against approval for Aradigm's (OTC:ARDM) Linhaliq (ciprofloxacin for inhalation) for the treatment of non-cystic fibrosis bronchiectasis patients with chronic lung infections from Pseudomonas aeruginosa.
    • Shares should resume trading after the close. A significant down move is a certainty.
    • Previously: Aradigm plummets 37% ahead of Ad Com review of Linhaliq (Jan. 9)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:52 PM | 64 Comments
  • PBI

    Pitney Bowes spikes on PE interest

    • Pitney Bowes (PBI +15.6%) shoots higher after CNBC reports that Carlyle and Blackstone have interest in making a bid for the company.
    • Shares of PBI traded as high as $13.68 earlier.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:48 PM
  • CMCSA

    NBC's Super Bowl ad inventory nearly sold out

    • Checking in with Super Bowl advertising: NBC (CMCSA +3.1%) is almost sold out of its inventory for this year.
    • It has a handful of spots available for the Feb. 4 championship game, it says, and is charging more than $5M for the average 30-second spot.
    • It's expecting ad sales revenue to exceed $900M for the Winter Olympics (also on the way next month) and should hit $1.4B from the Super Bowl and Olympics combined, according to NBC Sports' Dan Lovinger.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:23 PM | 2 Comments
  • DK

    Delek US upgraded, PBF Energy downgraded at Morgan Stanley

    • Delek US Holdings (DK +2.1%) is upgraded to Overweight from Equal Weight with a $44 price target, raised from $34, while refining peer PBF Energy (PBF -0.4%) is downgraded to Underweight from Equal Weight with a $37 target, up from $30, at Morgan Stanley.
    • The firm's upgrade of DK comes on the basis of the stock's valuation, locational advantage, meaningful MLP exposure and positioning for higher cash returns to shareholders.
    • In its PBF downgrade, Stanley cites earnings achievability risk given that 85% of the company's EBITDA is driven by refining, and the firm thinks PBF's logistics/MLP business has a lower growth outlook than peers.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:17 PM | 1 Comment
  • PPRUF

    Kering to spin off 70% stake in Puma

    • Kering SA (OTCPK:PPRUF) says it will spin off 70% of Puma to shareholders.
    • The French apparel company will be left with a 16% stake in Puma after the offering.
    • Kering says the offering will help shareholders realize the "future value creation" of Puma.
    • Kering closed down 1% in Paris trading.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:08 PM

  • Technology - Top Gainers / Losers as of 3.00 pm (1/11/18)

    • Gainers: CNIT-OLD +18%. PRGS +16%. CPAH +15%. TRVG +12%. SPWR +12%.
    • Losers: LEDS -28%. HMNY -11%. OTCPK:LFIN -10%. CBAK-OLD -10%. COGT -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:04 PM | 4 Comments
  • FSCT

    U.S. Department of Defense Awards ForeScout Enterprise-wide IoT Security Agreement; Shares +6%

    • ForeScout Technologies (FSCT +5.5%) announced that the U.S. Department of Defense awarded the company and its federal partners an enterprise-wide blanket purchase agreement through the U.S. military’s Enterprise Software Initiative program.
    • The said agreement provides the most current commercially available ForeScout products, maintenance and support for DoD, intelligence community and Coast Guard activities worldwide.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 2:52 PM
  • EXPE

    Morgan Stanley upgrades Expedia on overseas, vacation rental potential

    • Morgan Stanley upgrades Expedia (NASDAQ:EXPE) to Overweight with a $160 price target, 26% higher than yesterday’s close.
    • Analyst Brian Nowak says the company is “planting seeds for faster growth” by moving beyond the largest hotels in Europe and Asia.   
    • The firm thinks Expedia’s non-vacation supply count is about half of Priceline’s but that the “increased selection should lead to higher conversion and an increased ability to bid on Google keywords to drive traffic and user growth.” 
    • Nowak says Expedia’s acquired vacation rental business HomeAway is adding more supply and bookable properties to the Expedia platform. HomeAway could generate a 27% room night growth this year. 
    • Expedia shares are up 2.8%.  
    •   
     
     
     
     
    | 2:19 PM
  • CAR

    Avis and Hertz rally on enthusiams over travel demand

    • Avis Budget (CAR +4.9%) and Hertz Global (HTZ +5%) rally after unit revenue reports from the U.S. airline sector paint a bright picture for travel demand.
    • Both stocks have tracked back a bit from their highs posted earlier in the day.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:10 PM | 31 Comments
  • SEAS

    SeaWorld Entertainment jumps after Stifel raves

    • SeaWorld Entertainment (SEAS +6.6%) spikes on positive comments from Stifel Nicolaus after the firm walked away impressed from a meeting with management.
    • Analyst Steven Wieczynski sees momentum building for the theme park operator and thinks shorts could be in for a surprise.
    • Stifel takes its price target up to $17 to rep 13% upside.
    • Sources: Bloomberg, Nasdaq.com
     
     
     
     
    | 2:06 PM

  • Energy/Materials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 pm (1/12/2018)

    • Gainers: CCLP +17%. YUMA +14%. SND +14%. EXXI +13%. NOG +12%.
    • Losers: WLB -9%. AGI -7%. UEC -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM | 1 Comment
  • RICK

    Sidoti weighs in on RCI Hospitality

    • Sidoti updates on RCI Hospitality Holdings (RICK +3.5%) after factoring in the new tax laws.
    • "RICK is likely to see a substantial reduction in its 35% tax rate toward the 21% level, in our view. Using a 21% tax rate, our F2018 and F2019 EPS numbers would increase to $2.21 and $2.69, respectively."
    • "We maintain our Moderately Risky risk rating and $35 price target, which is based on 16x our F2019 EPS estimate of $2.20."
    • Sidoti also points to the preliminary FQ1 sales report from RCI, which it says continues to demonstrate the strong sales growth trend.
    • Source: Analyst note
     
     
     
     
    | 1:52 PM
  • FCEL

    FellCell Energy +8% after better than expected quarter, rising backlog

    • FuelCell Energy (FCEL +7.8%) powers higher after reporting a smaller than expected Q4 loss and a 95% Y/Y revenue increase to $47.9M, which also beat expectations..
    • FCEL says Q4 product sales totaled $39.9M, compared to just $8.4M for the year-ago quarter, primarily reflecting partial deliveries under a 20 MW order to a South Korean construction company for a utility project to be owned by Korea Southern Power Co. with deliveries beginning in Q4 and concluding in Q1 2018.
    • FCEL says its contract backlog totaled $554.2M as of Oct. 31 vs. $432.3M as of October 31, 2016, while also reporting record backlog and project awards of $1.6B.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:49 PM | 1 Comment
  • MCRB

    Seres presents pipeline update at JPM18; shares ahead 2%

    • Seres Therapeutics (MCRB +1.8%) CEO Roger Pomerantz, M.D. presented a corporate overview at JPM18 today. Key points:
    • Phase 3 ECOSPOR III study assessing lead candidate SER-109 for reducing the recurrence of Clostridium difficile (C. diff) infections in adult patients is ongoing. [According to ClinicalTrials,gov, the estimated primary completion date is February 2019].
    • SER-262: topline data from a Phase 1b study in primary C. diff infection expected this quarter.
    • SER-287: Phase 1b study in mild-to-moderate ulcerative colitis (UC) showed treatment effect on remission and endoscopic improvement with a favorable safety profile. Data to be presented at the European Crohn's and Colitis Organisation congress in mid-February. Next step: Obtain FDA guidance on new UC study expected to launch mid-year.
    • SER-301: follow-on to SER-287. Preclinical stage.
    • SER-401: study assessing combination with checkpoint inhibitors to launch this year.
    • #JPM18
     
     
     
     
    | 1:11 PM | 1 Comment

  • Financials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 1:00 PM

    • Gainers: BYFC +13%. MFIN +12%.WHLR +10%. TRUP +8%. MGI +6%.
    • Losers: NHLD -28%. JTPY -10%. ORC -8%. GCAP -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:04 PM | 9 Comments
  • COST

    Costco spikes after reports of Sam's Club closings

    • Shares of Costco (COST +1.8%) perk up after reports of a series of unexpected Sam's Club stores (NYSE:WMT).
    • Store closings in Cincinatti, Rochester and Houston have been reported locally.
    • More details to follow.
    • UPDATE: Walmart confirms that 63 Sam's Club stores have been closed.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:03 PM | 29 Comments
  • AUY

    Yamana Gold reports strong FY 2017, Q4 production

    • Yamana Gold (AUY +3.9%) is higher after reporting FY 2017 production for both gold and copper exceeded its higher guidance levels set in October.
    • Preliminary 2017 gold production totaled 977K oz. vs. 960K oz. October guidance, and full-year silver output of slightly more than 5M oz. vs. 5M oz. guidance; for Q4, gold production was 259K oz. and silver output was 1.17M oz.
    • AUY says 2017 production provides a significant production platform which it expects to enhance in 2018 through further operational improvements and with the startup of the high-grade Cerro Moro gold-silver mine.
    • AUY also says it will receive $125M as part of a new copper advanced sales program in exchange for 40.3M lbs. of copper to be delivered in H2 2018 and H1 2019, representing about a third of planned production during the period.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM | 14 Comments

    Hospital operators on the move

    • Hospital operators are enjoying an up day along with the broader market.
    • Selected tickers: (UHS +2.9%)(HUM +0.5%)(HCA +2%)(THC +5%)(CYH +18.7%)(QHC +3.3%)(HLTH +3.7%)(LPNT +3.9%)
    • Previously: Shanda Group increases investment in Community Health Systems (Jan. 11)

    | 12:10 PM
  • STM

    Credit Suisse upgrades STMicroelectronics on margin potential

    • Credit Suisse upgrades STMicroelectronics (NYSE:STM) to Outperform.
    • Firm is optimistic margins will continue to expand for the iPhone supplier.
    • Latest analyst recommendations: 1 Buy, 2 Outperform, 1 Hold, 1 Underperform, and 1 Sell. 
    • Median price target: $23.50. 
    • STM shares are up 2.3% to $24.02.         
     
     
     
     
    | 12:10 PM | 21 Comments

  • Consumer - Top Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 pm (1/11/2018)

    • Gainers: XNY +21%. NBEV +12%. KBSF +11%. FUV +10%. REV +8%.
    • Losers: KODK -15%.

  • MU

    Needham defends Micron on Intel split

    • Needham & Co. defends Micron (NASDAQ:MU), saying the Street misunderstood the news that Micron and Intel will stop co-developing NAND chips after the next version.
    • Analyst Rajvindra Gill spoke with Micron CFO Ernie Maddock and says sticking with Intel carried a higher “opportunity cost” than taking on R&D expense to go it alone.
    • Needham calls concerns about NAND pricing decline overblown and thinks Micron’s target of over 50% NAND bit growth will coincide with a 25% to 30% drop in bit costs.
    • Rating: Buy, $76 price target.
    • Sources: Briefing.com / Barron’s.
    • Micron shares are down 1.1% today and 3.7% this week.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM | 168 Comments
  • HTBK

    Heritage Commerce Corp and United American Bank agree to combine

    • Heritage Commerce Corp (HTBK +0.2%) & United American Bank (OTCPK:UABK +7.4%) jointly announced the execution of a definitive agreement and plan of merger and reorganization. United American will merge into Heritage Bank of Commerce in a transaction valued at ~$44.2M.
    • The merger is expected to be completed in the Q218, (Subject to regulatory, shareholders approval & other customary closing conditions, including the approvals of the transaction that is intended to qualify as a tax-free reorganization for U.S. federal income tax purposes and United American common stock shareholders are not expected to recognize gain or loss to the extent they receive stock as consideration).
    • Heritage will issue ~2.8M of its shares of common stock to the United American common and preferred shareholders in the merger. Additionally, outstanding Series A Preferred Stock and Series B Preferred Stock will be exchanged for $9.1M in cash at closing.
    • Under the terms of the Agreement, shareholders of United American will receive a fixed exchange ratio of 2.1644 shares of Heritage common stock for each share of United American common stock and each common stock equivalent underlying the United American Series D Preferred Stock and Series E Preferred Stock.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 11:51 AM
  • FSLR

    First Solar skies to 52-week high after analyst Johnson calls shares a Buy

    • First Solar (FSLR +8.7%) breaks out to a new 52-week high after Vertical Group analyst Gordon Johnson - who recently moved over from Axiom Capital - initiates coverage with a Buy rating.
    • FSLR is “decidedly undervalued” for its portfolio of project assets and, despite the stock’s 76% surge over the last six months, is expected to outperform peers over the next year, Johnson says.
    • At the same time, Johnson initiates Solaredge Technologies (SEDG +1.1%) with a Sell rating, as he anticipates an accelerated decline in average selling prices compounded by irreducible manufacturing costs and heightened operating expenses.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:32 AM | 49 Comments
  • ATVI

    Activision shutters only U.S. physical distribution center

    • Amid an ongoing shift to digital videogame purchases, Activision Blizzard (ATVI +3%) has closed down its only U.S. distribution center.
    • A shutdown of the Fresno, Calif., center last week resulted in layoffs of 50. The location packed and shipped titles including the Call of Duty series, World of WarCraft and StarCraft.
    • That's the result of efforts to consolidate warehousing, the company says, and it's contracted with an existing partner to take over from Fresno.
    • "It is unrelated" to the migration to digital downloads, which now make up about half of purchases vs. physical game titles, a spokesman says.
    • Previously: Activision +1.9% as Piper likes opening of esports league (Jan. 11 2018)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM | 6 Comments
  • CJREF

    Corus sees downgrades after disappointing Q1 earnings

    • Corus Entertainment (OTCPK:CJREF) has declined another 4.2% the day after a tumble due to disappointing earnings weighed down by declining TV ad revenues.
    • The stock's trading ex-dividend today, but is also seeing analyst downgrades after the earnings miss.
    • Three previous Buys have gone to Neutral-equivalent. Scotiabank has cut the stock to Sector Perform, as has National Bank.
    • Desjardins has downgraded shares to Hold and set a price target of C$11.50, implying 30% upside from today's Toronto price of C$8.83. (OTC shares are trading at $7.02.)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:09 AM | 42 Comments

  • Healthcare - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 11:00 am

    • Gainers: CYH +18%. PRTO +13%. CUR +9%. CORI +9%. CERC +9%.
    • Losers: LPCN -42%. PAVM -10%. GENE -7%. PTIE -7%. NVAX -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM | 2 Comments
  • SJR

    Shaw Communications -2.3% as Q1 falls short

    • Shaw Communications (NYSE:SJR) is 2.3% lower after its Q1 earnings missed expectations on top and bottom lines.
    • Revenues overall ticked up 2.5%, led by wireless performance which mitigated flat results in its wireline division.
    • Operating income (before restructuring/amortization) fell 4.6%, though, to C$481M, and operating margin declined to 38.5% from 41.4%. Free cash flow slipped by two-thirds to C$51M due to lower operating income and higher capital spending.
    • Wireless subscribers grew by about 130,000 subscribers for the year to hit almost 1.2M. It added 34,000 wireless subs for the quarter.
    • Wireline subscribers fell by about 34,000 for the quarter despite Internet sub gains of more than 17,000 (more than offset by video, phone and higher seasonal satellite losses).
    • Revenue by segment: Wireline, C$1.075B (down 0.4%); Wireless, C$175M (up 26.8%).
    • The company says it's on track to meet fiscal 2018 guidance for operating income (before restructuring/amortization) of C$2.1B (a 5% Y/Y increase), capital investments of about C$1.38B and free cash flow of C$375M. Most growth in operating income will come in the back half.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM | 1 Comment
  • HA

    Argus warns on new competition for Hawaiian Holdings

    • Argus lowers Hawaiian Holdings (HA +0.1%) to a Hold rating from Buy on concerns over increased competition.
    • "With both United Continental and Southwest Airlines entering the West Coast-to-Hawaii market and a competitor expanding aggressively in the intra-island market, we expect HA's yields to deteriorate," warns analyst John Staszak.
    • "We note that Southwest has typically reduced fares by 15%-25% when entering new markets," he adds.
    • Staszak and team also point to the 6% to 7% annual increase in costs at Hawaiian Holdings.
    • "If the company is able to offset the impact of new competition and hold the line on costs, we would consider returning the stock to our BUY list," sums up Staszak.
    • Source: Analyst note
     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM | 1 Comment
  • DLTR

    Guggenheim positive on Dollar Tree

    • Guggenheim upgrades Dollar Tree (DLTR -0.3%) to a Buy rating from Neutral on its view that the company qualifies as both a growth and turnaround story.
    • The retailer lands a price target of $125 from Guggenheim to rep 15% upside potential. The 52-week high for Dollar Tree is $111.63.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:38 AM | 22 Comments
  • WATT

    Energous founder and CTO stepping into contractor role, not seeking board re-election

    • Energous (NASDAQ:WATT) reveals that founder, SVP, and CTO Michael Leabman is leaving his role effective immediately.
    • Leabman will serve as an independent contractor for the company for two years and has agreed not to stand for re-election to the board. 
    • The revelation came through a regulatory filing, not a press release.
    • Energous shares are down 1.6%.  
    • Previously: Energous +63% on FCC certification (Dec. 26, 2017)
    • Previously: Energous competitor receives FCC approval (Dec. 28, 2017)
    • Previously: Citron Research tweets Energous' "history of deception"; shares drop 6.4% (Dec. 29, 2017)
    • Previously: Energous opens preorders for first WattUp-enabled products; shares +13.5% (Jan. 8)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM | 95 Comments
  • SHLDQ

    Sears Holdings bid up 9%

    • Sears Holdings (SHLD) is up 8.8% in what could be an extended reaction to yesterday's financing moves announced by the embattled retailer.
    • The company found an additional $200M in cost savings outside of store closing and raised a cool $100M in new financing.
    • There's also some reports that Sears is considering digital gift cards with a Bitcoin tie-in. Nothing official has come down from the company on the crypto front, but plenty of jokes about a Bitcoin/blockchain name change are circulating.
    • Previously: Sears updates on profitability plan (Jan. 10)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:23 AM | 72 Comments
  • KODK

    Kodak cools off, what next?

  • INTC

    Intel releases "Security-First Pledge" after chip flaw criticism

    • Intel (NASDAQ:INTC) posts a “Security-First Pledge” from CEO Brian Krzanich that includes three commitments to customers in the wake of the chip security flaws.
    • Intel says at least 90% of Intel CPUs released in the past five years will be updated by January 15. Updates will then begin for older products. 
    • Promising better transparency: “We know that the impact on performance varies widely, based on the specific workload, platform configuration, and mitigation technique. We commit to provide frequent progress reports of patch progress, performance data and other information.” 
    • Security assurance: Intel will “publicly identify significant security vulnerabilities following rules of responsible disclosure” and add funding for security threat research.   
    • Intel shares are up 0.5% today and down 7.9% YTD.    
    • Previously: Tech giants scurry to patch chip flaws; Intel -2.6% (Jan. 4)
    • Previously: Tech giants see little performance impact from Intel chip issues (Jan. 5)
    • Previously: Intel unveils security updates, self-driving car (Jan. 9)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:54 AM | 19 Comments

  • IBM

    The Register: IBM moving 30% of GTS jobs with Bain's help

    • IBM (NYSE:IBM) plans to reassign 30% of the staff from its 103K-member GTS business this year, according to The Register.  
    • Sources say IBM hired Bain to help with the reorganization of Global Technology Services.
    • The Register published a slide, credited to an IBM internal presentation, which shows 10,100 GTS jobs classified as “Attrition w/o backfill,” which means the moving staffers won’t be replaced. 
    • IBM hasn’t reported top-line growth in 22 quarters. The company generated $92B in cash from 2012 to 2017 but returned 80% to shareholders. 
    • IBM reports Q4 results January 19. 
    • IBM shares are up 0.22%.

  • MGI

    Moneygram soars after announcing Ripple partnership

    • Shares of Moneygram International (NYSE:MGI) skyrocket after the company says it will test partnering with cryptocurrency Ripple on payments.
    • MoneyGram will pilot the use of XRP in payment flows through Ripple's xRapid, solution for on-demand liquidity.
    • The company says XRP remains the most efficient digital asset for payments with transaction fees at just fractions of a penny, compared to Bitcoin fees of about $30 per transaction.
    • XRP is fast too. The average transaction time for XRP is 2 to 3 seconds with other top digital assets ranging from 15 minutes to an hour for a payment transaction.
    • MGI +29.21% premarket to $15.66.
    • Source: Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 9:19 AM | 10 Comments

  • NFLX

    Barclays a big believer in Netflix

    • Barclays keeps it simple in laying out why Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) is an attractive investment and is likely to become the second biggest pure media company outside of Disney within three to five years.
    • "Netflix bull case at the core is relatively simple – if subscriber growth is faster than content cost growth over time, it could become one of the most successful media companies. We believe this is possible," writes analyst Kannan Venkateshwar.
    • "Our view is supported by Netflix's global footprint and access to ~550mm broadband subs, demonstrated pricing power, growing content library, changing mix towards local content, and its increasing 'stickiness' due to multiple seasons of established originals," he adds.
    • Netflix is initiated by Barclays at Overweight and assigned a price target of $245.
    • NFLX +0.92% premarket to $214.48.

  • Hawkish tilt to ECB minutes sends euro higher

    • "The language pertaining to various dimensions of the monetary- policy stance and forward guidance could be revisited early this year," according to the minutes of the ECB's mid-December meeting.
    • "A gap appeared to be emerging between favorable economic conditions and a policy stance that remained in a crisis configuration," says one member of the Governing Council.
    • The wording has sparked a 60 pip move higher in the euro vs. the dollar, with the common currency now buying $1.1994. European stocks remain  modestly in the green.

  • MEIP

    Helsinn Group and MEI Pharma announce that pracinostat has received ODD from EMA for the treatment of AML

    • Privately held Helsinn Group and MEI Pharma (NASDAQ:MEIP) announce that the European Medicines Agency (EMA) has granted Orphan Drug Designation to pracinostat, an investigational drug candidate currently in a Phase 3 study in combination with azacitidine for the treatment of acute myeloid leukemia (AML) in adult patients unfit to induction chemotherapy.
    • Among the benefits of Orphan Drug status in the EU is a 10-year period of market exclusivity for the indication, if approved.
    • Pracinostat is an oral histone deacetylase inhibitor that is in late-stage clinical development.
    • Shares of MEIP are up 17% premarket on light volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:44 AM | 1 Comment

  • SSNC

    SS&C confirms DST acquisition for $84 per share

    • SS&C (NASDAQ:SSNC) confirms it will acquire DST (NYSE:DST) for $84 per share in cash.
    • The deal has an enterprise value of $5.4B including debt. The combined business has about $3.9B in revenue and 13K clients. 
    • SS&C expects the deal to become immediately accretive to its EPS and expects the run-rate cost savings to total $150M annually by 2020. 
    • Why buy? DST’s retirement and wealth management solutions for U.S. clients give SS&C access to the $25T retirement market. 
    • SS&C shares are up 0.9% premarket after closing yesterday up 12.8%. 
    • DST shares are up 3.5% premarket after closing up 22.6%.

  • DAL

    Delta tops estimates, hikes profit guidance

    • Delta Air Lines (NYSE:DAL) reports adjusted pre-tax income for Q4 was $1.0B.
    • The quarter included a negative $60M impact from the combination of a power outage at Atlanta's Hartsfield-Jackson Airport and Winter Storm Benji.
    • The company says it brought in adjusted pre-tax income of $5.5B for the full year vs. $6.12B a year ago.
    • Passenger unit revenues increased 4.2% during Q4, cargo revenue was up 14.4%.
    • "Looking ahead to 2018, we expect to drive solid earnings growth by growing our top line 4 to 6 percent, improving our cost trajectory and integrating our international partner network.  As a result, we are able to increase our previous full-year guidance to $6.35 to $6.70 per share due to additional benefits from tax reform," updates Delta CEO Ed Bastian.
    • Delta expects unit revenue growth of 2.5% to 4.5% in Q1 and EPS of $0.60 to $0.80. The company sees 2018 EPS of $6.35-$6.70 vs. $5.35-$5.70 prior and $6.30 consensus.
    • DAL +1.25% premarket to $56.56
    • Source: Press Release
    • Previously: Delta Air Lines beats by $0.07, beats on revenue (Jan. 11)
